8.<CMD_JUMP>[\u9577\u62bc/\u306a\u304c\u30:
Hold <CMD_JUMP> while moving to [CR2]run[C]!
Quickly tap <CMD_JUMP> to [CR2]jump[C]!

9.[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u306e[\u4eba/\u307:
You can interact with certain characters
by approaching them and pressing <CMD_ACT>!

10.[\u898b/\u307f]\u3065\u3089\u3044\u3068\:
You can control the camera with [$gaiji_rst_s000].
Press <CMD_CAMERA_RESET> to reset the camera view.

11.\u307e\u305a\u306f\u3000[\u57fa\u672c\u4:
Let's start with the basics!
You can [CR2]move[C] with [$gaiji_lst_s000]!

12.[\u898b/\u307f]\u3065\u3089\u3044\u3068\:
You can control the camera with [$gaiji_rst_s000] .
Press <CMD_CAMERA_RESET> to reset the camera view.

15.[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u306e[\u4e2d/\u306:
There is a [CR2]minimap[C] on the bottom left of the screen.
It displays a lot of useful information!

16.[\u73fe\u5728/\u3052\u3093\u3056\u3044]\:
The minimap shows the weather and current time.
If you're ever lost, try checking the minimap!

17.<CMD_MINIMAP_RESIZE>\u3092[\u62bc/\u304a:
You can increase the minimap size by pressing <CMD_MINIMAP_RESIZE>.
It'll show things a bit farther away!

18.[\u753b\u9762/\u304c\u3081\u3093]\u306e[:
Located at the top of the screen is a [CR2]compass[C].
It'll show you what direction your objective is.

19.\u3069\u3061\u3089\u3082\u3000\u305b\u30:
Both can be disabled in the Settings app.
With less display you might get lost easier!

22.[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u306e[\u4e2d/\u306:
Pressing <CMD_MAP_MENU> in the city opens the [CR2]map[C] screen.
It will show the area around you!

23.[\u9060/\u3068\u304a]\u304f\u306e[CR2][\:
Far [CR2]destinations[C] and [CR2]shops[C] locations are clearly
displayed! When in doubt, open and view the map!

24.\u30de\u30c3\u30d7\u3092[\u958b/\u3072\u:
While the map is open, you can
press <CMD_ENTER> to insert a [CR2]map pin[C].

25.\u3053\u308c\u304b\u3089[\u884c/\u3044]\:
It can be useful to place a map pin
on your destination or point of interest!

28.[CG2]\u30ca\u30d3\u30ef\u30f3[C]\u306f\u:
[CG2]Naviwoof[C] can [CR2]guide[C] you to your destination.
If you get lost, just follow [CR2]Naviwoof[C].

29.\u30ca\u30d3\u30ef\u30f3\u306f\u3000\u30:
It may take detours to find hidden treasures or Yo-kai.
Sorry if this happens when you don't want it to.

30.\u30ca\u30d3\u30ef\u30f3\u306e\u30ac\u30:
Press <CMD_AUTO_NAVI> to enable [CR2]auto navigation[C].
It's like an auto pilot mode!

31.\u307e\u305f\u3000<CMD_NAVIWAN_GUIDE>\u3:
You can also press <CMD_NAVIWAN_GUIDE> to open the [CR2]Naviwoof Guide[C].
Pick a map pin to have Naviwoof go there.

32.\u30ca\u30d3\u30ef\u30f3\u3092\u3000[\u8:
You can also let it walk freely. It's good
to let the doggie have a nice walk too.

34.\u30b9\u30c8\u30fc\u30ea\u30fc\u306a\u30:
Here are some useful options available
while viewing the story or events.

35.<CMD_EVENT_SKIP_HOLD>\u3092[\u6570\u79d2:
Hold down <CMD_EVENT_SKIP_HOLD> for a few seconds to [CR2]skip events[C].
As long as <CMD_EVENT_FAST_FORWARD_HOLD> is held, you can [CR2]fast forward[C].

36.\u3068\u30fb\u306f\u30fb\u3044\u30fb\u30:
A.L.S.O! You guys won't skip
[CR2]my big successes[C] of course! Right?

38.\u304a\u306c\u3057\u3089\u306e[\u6301/\u:
Your [CR2]Watch Rank[C] of your [CG]Yo-kai Watch[C]
represents it's performance.

39.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e9\u30f3\u30:
To raise your rank, you'll have to pass trials
and adversities of a Yo-kai expert like myself..

40.[\u8a66\u7df4/\u3057\u308c\u3093]\u3068\:
Complete the trials and tribulations of my
quests to raise all your Yo-kai Watch Rank!

41.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e9\u30f3\u30:
As rank increases, you'll befriend stronger
Yo-kai and open new [CR2]Watch Locks[C].

42.[\u9ad8/\u3053\u3046]\u30e9\u30f3\u30af\:
High-ranked Watch Locks always have
stronger Yo-kai and cool items behind!

45.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
In the Watch Mode of the Yo-kai Watch,
you can find hidden Yo-kai!

46.[\u602a/\u3042\u3084]\u3057\u3044[\u6c17:
If you sense a suspicious presence, hold <CMD_AIM>
to [CR2]Search[C] with the Yo-kai Watch!

47.[$gaiji_rst_s000]\uff32\u30b9\u30c6\u30a:
Use the [$gaiji_rst_s000] R-stick to move the searchlight!
You'll get a special response from hidden Yo-kai.

48.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044][:
Many other things are hidden in the world.
Use your Watch if you spot something suspicious!

49.[$gaiji_rst_s000][\u53f3/\u307f\u304e]\u:
Use the [$gaiji_rst_s000] R-stick to move the searchlight!
If there are any Yo-kai hiding, you'll get a special response.

51.[\u5996\u9b54/\u3088\u3046\u307e]\u30ec\: Discover Yo-kai around you with the Yo-kai Radar!

52.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e2\u30fc\u30:
Searching in Watch Mode can be difficult.
In such case, use the [CG2]"Yo-kai Radar"[C]!

53.[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u306e[\u4e2d/\u306:
If you press the <CMD_RADAR> R stick button,
you can search the surroundings.

54.[\u5996\u9b54/\u3088\u3046\u307e]\u30ec\:
Yo-kai found on the Yo-kai radar will be displayed
on the screen or minimap [$gaiji_mmap_search01] for a while.

55.[$gaiji_mmap_search01]\u304c[\u898b/\u30:
If you see a [$gaiji_mmap_search01], go check it out
and start searching with Watch Mode!

56.[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u306e[\u4e2d/\u306:
If you press the <CMD_RADAR> R3 button, you can
search the surroundings with the Yo-kai radar.

59.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e2\u30fc\u30:
Occasionally found in Watch mode, the suspicious
amount of energy is... The [CR2]Yo-Gunk[C]!

60.[\u5996\u6c17\u6c5a\u67d3/\u3088\u3046\u:
Yo-kai and items are hidden inside.
Aim at the [CR2]Yo-Gunk[C] and use <CMD_VACUUM>!

61.\u3046\u307e\u304f[\u5f53/\u3042]\u305f\:
Successfully hit it and a [CR2]Yo-Gunk Battle[C]
will start!Press and hold <CMD_PULL> to fill the gauge.

62.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb[\u4e2d/\u3061\u3085\u:
During battle, the Yo-Gunk may attack!
Use <CMD_PULL_GUARD> to [CR2]guard[C] at the right time to bounce it back!

63.\u30b2\u30fc\u30b8\u304c[\u6700\u5927/\u:
When the gauge reaches its maximum
press <CMD_PULL_TAKE_OFF>! It can now be [CR2]cleaned[C]!

64.\u3072\u3063\u307a\u304c\u3057[\u6210\u5:
By removing the Yo-Gunk, you won!
Hidden Yo-kai will trigger a battle.

65.[\u5996\u6c17\u6c5a\u67d3/\u3088\u3046\u:
Defeating the Yo-kai from the Yo-Gunk
will sometimes reward you with [CR2]rare items[C]!

67.[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u3084\u30c0\u30f3\:
A mysterious object floating in the
streets and dungeons... This is [CG2]Eyepo[C] Nyan!

68.\u30ad\u30e5\u30c3\u30d4\u30fc\u306b[\u8:
Just talk to Eyepo and all the members
will recover [CR2]HP and YP[C]!

69.\u3069\u3093\u306a[\u5834\u6240/\u3070\u:
You can freely organize [CR2]members[C] and
keep your [CR2]diary[C] updated anytime.

70.\u30d4\u30f3\u30c1\u306e\u3068\u304d\u30:
You can do all this in an instant!
Always check out Eyepo when you see it!

72.\u307a\u308d\uff5e\u3093\uff01\u3000\u30: We, [CG2]Mirapo[C], will warp you to various places!

73.[\u5404\u5730/\u304b\u304f\u3061]\u306b\:
Talking to Mirapo scattered in various places will
increase the places you can teleport to!

74.\u305d\u3057\u3066\uff01\u3000\u307f\u30:
Also, everyone has a [CG2]Pocket Mirapo[C]
to warp anytime, anywhere!

75.<CMD_FUNC4>\u3067\u30de\u30c3\u30d7\u309:
After opening the map with <CMD_FUNC4>, press <CMD_FUNC3>. You can
choose the destination to warp with Mirapo!

76.\u3046\u3093\u304c\u3044\u30cd\u30c3\u30:
Our network goes beyond the world! <CMD_CHANGE_BACK1><CMD_CHANGE_NEXT1>
allows you to choose the world to warp into!

78.\u30a2\u30fc\u30af\u306e\u30c8\u30d3\u30: Go to the Shadowside world using Keystones

79.[\u4e16/\u3088]\u306e[\u4e2d/\u306a\u304:
Everything in this world has a shadowside...
That's right, even our city we live in.

80.[\u8857\u4e2d/\u307e\u3061\u306a\u304b]\:
[CR2]"Keystone Doors"[C] are hiding in the city
and connect to this Shadowside World.

81.\u3075\u3057\u304e\u306a\u30ab\u30ae\u30:
If you own any [CG2]Mysterious Keys[C], you can
enter the [CR2]"Shadow Time"[C] from the door!

82.\u30b7\u30e3\u30c9\u30a6\u30bf\u30a4\u30:
At Shadow Time, Yo-kai are powerful!
Be careful when you battle them!

83.\u3055\u3089\u306b\uff01\u3000[\u7279\u5:
Also, something strange will happen when entering
the Shadow World using a special Keystone!

84.[\u7279\u5b9a/\u3068\u304f\u3066\u3044]\:
You will challenge ridiculously strong
Yo-kai or meet a very specific tribe.

85.[\u7279\u5225/\u3068\u304f\u3079\u3064]\:
The special Keystones will disappear once
they are used. If you own one, try it out!

86.\u305d\u308c\u306b\u3000[\u7279\u5225/\u:
Besides, the game [CR2]automatically saves[C]
your progress! Think carefully before using it!

89.\u30a2\u30fc\u30af\u306e\u30c8\u30d3\u30:
There is a dangerous Keystone door
named [CR2]"Yo-kai Bosses Door"[C]!

90.[\u5927\u5996\u9b54/\u3060\u3044\u3088\u:
Beyond the Yo-kai Bosses Door, an evil
[CR2]Yo-kai Boss[C] already fought is waiting for you!

91.\u3057\u304b\u3082\u3000\u3055\u3089\u30:
Moreover, you can fight stronger Yo-kai Bosses
with [CR2]"SUPER"[C] and [CR2]"ULTRA"[C] options!

92.[\u6b63\u76f4/\u3057\u3087\u3046\u3058\u:
It seems to be challenging, but
once you became stronger, try it out!

93.[\u5927\u5996\u9b54/\u3060\u3044\u3088\u:
Yo-kai Bosses Doors appear next to where we
previously [CR2]fought them[C]. Let's find these doors!

95.\u30d9\u30c3\u30c9\u3084\u30d9\u30f3\u30: Use beds or a benches to rest

96.[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u306e[\u4e2d/\u306:
As you walk around the city, the time
gradually passes and the weather changes.

97.[\u81ea\u5206/\u3058\u3076\u3093]\u306e[:
You can sleep in your [CR2]bed[C] until morning, night
or whenever you want with the [CR2]alarm clock[C].

98.[\u8857\u4e2d/\u307e\u3061\u306a\u304b]\:
Just like the alarm clock, you can
rest on [CR2]benches[C] in the city.

99.\u30d0\u30af\u306e[\u80fd\u529b/\u306e\u:
With my ability, you don't need to sleep, but it's
convenient to change the time and weather!

102.[\u5996\u602a\u63a2\u5075\u56e3/\u3088\u:
We, Yo-kai bosses the YDT once fought,
are back in our [CR2]"ULTRA Boss"[C] version!

103.[\u5927\u5996\u9b54/\u3060\u3044\u3088\u:
Defeat Super Yo-kai Bosses and use the
[CG2]"Ultra Blazing Orb"[C] at Yo-kai Bosses Doors.

104.[\u708e\u6975/\u3048\u3093\u3054\u304f]\:
Ultra Bosses are deadly! The [CR2]"Blazing Orb"[C]
will burn you like the flames of hell!

105.\u305d\u306e[\u9593/\u3042\u3044\u3060]\:
Meanwhile, allies continue to get [CR2]burning damages[C]!
Detectives... shake in front of our true power!

106.\u3060\u304c\u3000[\u708e\u6975/\u3048\u:
However, Ultra Bosses can also drop
[CR2]transcendental rare items[C]! Have at it!

107.\u300e\u3067\u305f\u30ac\u30b7\u30e3[\u5: Try your luck in the "Deta Crank-a-Game"!

108.[\u5996\u9b54\u754c/\u3088\u3046\u307e\u:
At the Demon Arena in the Yo-kai World,
your luck can be challenged the against Yo-kai.♥

109.\u307e\u305a\u306f\u3000[\u53d7\u4ed8/\u:
First of all, talk to the receptionist [CG2]Gutsy Bones[C]
or others to turn their Crank-a-Kai.

110.\u30ac\u30b7\u30e3[\u7389/\u3060\u307e]\:
then, battle the Yo-kai that came out of it!
Please look forward to seeing it ♪

111.[\u51fa/\u3067]\u3066\u304f\u308b[\u5996:
The Yo-kai coming out are strong, but many
 rewards and souls are to be expected.

112.\u305f\u307e\uff5e\u306b[\u51fa/\u3067]\:
If you defeat [CG2]Noko[C] who appears occasionally,
you'll get plenty of money and experience... ♥

113.\u3067\u305f\u30ac\u30b7\u30e3[\u52dd\u8:
You can try it for free
[CR2]once a day[C] in real life!

114.\u3055\u3089\u306b\u3000\uff11[\u56de/\u:
Furthermore, even after you did it once,
[CR2]give us money[C] to fight as many times as you want to. ♥

115.[\u9b3c\u95d8\u6280\u5834/\u304a\u306b\u:
Go to the Yo-kai Arena every day and
try getting stronger and stronger.♪

117.[\u9ad8\u57ce\u90b8/\u305f\u304b\u3057\u:
In Takashiro mansion, [CG2]Yamambaa[C]
has settled down and is wandering around.

118.[\u5c71\u59e5/\u3084\u307e\u3093\u3070]\:
Find the hidden key in her room,
[CR2]but do not get caught by Yamambaa[C]

119.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e2\u30fc\u30:
If you search the floor in [CR2]Watch mode[C],
you might find some clues!

120.[\u5c71\u59e5/\u3084\u307e\u3093\u3070]\:
Yamambaa can sense you from far away...
Walk slowly with the [$gaiji_lst_s000] L-stick down a little.

121.\u3055\u3089\u306b\u3000[\u5c4b\u6577/\u:
Furthermore, walking on Yamambaa footsteps will
get you in trouble, be careful of your footprints!

122.[\u5c71\u59e5/\u3084\u307e\u3093\u3070]\:
Be careful, if you are found by Yamambaa
you will start [CR2]all over again[C] from my room.

123.[\u5c71\u59e5/\u3084\u307e\u3093\u3070]\:
Yamambaa actually has very good ears.
[$gaiji_lst_s000] Tilt the left stick a little and walk slowly!

124.[\u767d\u864e/\u3073\u3083\u3063\u3053]\: Hide from the White Tiger and be on the lookout!

125.[\u970a\u5263\u6797/\u308c\u3044\u3051\u:
In Reikenrin, you have to be on the lookout from
the [CG2]White Tiger[C] and [CR2]guardian Yo-kai[C]!

126.[\u898b\u5f35/\u307f\u306f]\u308a\u306e[:
If you get spotted by Yo-kai,
the [CR2]Danger Gauge[C] will rise up!

127.\u3053\u306e\u30b2\u30fc\u30b8\u304c\uff:
When the gauge reaches 100%, you will get
caught and forced to start [CR2]all over again[C]!

128.\u3067\u3082\u3042\u305f\u3057\u3000\u30:
But I found something amazing! You can
[CR2]lower[C] the gauge with shiny bamboos!

129.\u305d\u308c\u306b\u3000[\u767d\u864e/\u:
Even if you are caught, you can start from
[CR2]the shiny bamboos[C] again! They are so amazing!

130.[\u970a\u5263\u6797/\u308c\u3044\u3051\u:
Shiny bamboos can be found while
hiding from the white tiger and guardian Yo-kai!

132.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u306b[\u53c2\u52a0/\u:
Members who participate in battles
have various stats.

133.[CR2]\u300e\uff28\uff30\u300f[C]\u306f\u:
[CR2]"HP"[C] is the member physical strength.
When reaching zero, you won't be able to act!

134.[CR2]\u300e\uff39\uff30\u300f[C]\u306f\u:
[CR2]"YP"[C] stands for Yo-kai Power. It is needed
to use your techniques!

135.[CR2]\u300e[\u8155\u529b/\u308f\u3093\u3:
[CR2]"STR"[C] and [CR2]"DEF"[C] affect attack and
defense such as swords and punches.

136.[CR2]\u300e[\u5996\u529b/\u3088\u3046\u3:
[CR2]"SPR"[C] and [CR2]"RES"[C] affect magic attack
and magic defense such as staffs.

137.[CR2]\u300e\u3059\u3070\u3084\u3055\u300:
[CR2]"SPD"[C] affects movement speed during battle.
The higher, the easier you dodge!

138.\u300e\u3059\u3070\u3084\u3055\u300f[\u4:
Aside "SPD", you can increase stats by [CR2]leveling up[C].
Raise your levels and become stronger!

140.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u306b[\u53c2\u52a0/\u:
Members of a battle can be
seperated into two [CR2]Battle Roles[C].

141.[$gaiji_Role_Watcher_01][CR2]\u30a6\u30a:
[$gaiji_Role_Watcher_01] [CR2]The Watcher[C] is the owner of the Yo-kai Watch.
Different Watches means different effects in battle!

142.[$gaiji_Role_Attacker_01][CR2]\u30a2\u30:
[$gaiji_Role_Attacker_01] [CR2]The Attacker[C] is a Yo-kai who use physical attacks.
Battles areHand-to-hand combat or with items!

143.[$gaiji_Role_Tank_01][CR2]\u30bf\u30f3\u:
[$gaiji_Role_Tank_01] [CR2]The Tank[C] is a Yo-kai with high "Defense".
A Tank's job is to protect the team!

144.[$gaiji_Role_Healer_01][CR2]\u30d2\u30fc:
[$gaiji_Role_Healer_01] [CR2]The Healer[C] is a Yo-kai healing allies.
A Healer can heal or strengthen allies!

145.[$gaiji_Role_Shooter_01][CR2]\u30b7\u30e:
[$gaiji_Role_Shooter_01] [CR2]The Shooter[C] is a Yo-kai who attacks with magic.
A Shooter's job is to assist the team!

148.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
Watchers and Yo-kai can use their own
[CR2]Moves[C] and [CR2]Skills[C] during battle.

149.\u308f\u3056\u306f\u3000\u30d0\u30c8\u30:
A [CR2]soultimate move[C] is a special attack or recovery.
However, using such move will cost you YP.

150.\u30b9\u30ad\u30eb\u306f\u3000\u30d0\u30:
[CR2]Skills[C] are automatically activated during battle.
They have a variety of special effects!

151.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
Level up to be able to perform more moves,
but only one skill is available per Yo-kai.

152.[\u4e00\u65b9/\u3044\u3063\u307d\u3046]\:
The Watcher, on the other hand, can learn
many tricks and skills with his [CR2]Watch Skill[C]!

153.\u3055\u3089\u306b\u3000\u30a6\u30a9\u30:
In addition, the Watcher can freely switch between
moves,so let's try out some new ones!

155.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\: There are many different Yo-kai tribes.

156.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
There are many different tribes of Yo-kai.
Yo-kai can be divided into [CR2]six tribes[C].

157.[$gaiji_Race_Onnen_01][CR2]\u30aa\u30f3\:
[$gaiji_Race_Onnen_01] [CR2]The Onnen Tribe[C] are Yo-kai who hold grudges.
[$gaiji_Race_Goriki_01] [CR2]The Goriki Tribe[C] are Yo-kai who have amazing strength.

158.[$gaiji_Race_Omamori_01][CR2]\u30aa\u30d:
[$gaiji_Race_Omamori_01] [CR2]The Omamori Tribe[C] are Yo-kai who have righteous spirits.
[$gaiji_Race_Mononoke_01] [CR2]The Mononoke Tribe[C] are beast-like Yo-kai

159.[$gaiji_Race_Tsukumono_01][CR2]\u30c4\u3:
[$gaiji_Race_Tsukumono_01] [CR2]The Tsukumono Tribe[C] are Yo-kai who were born from inanimate objects.
[$gaiji_Race_Uwanosora_01] [CR2]The Uwanosora Tribe[C] are Yo-kai who don't follow a particular theme.

160.[\u4ed6/\u307b\u304b]\u306b\u3082\u3000\:
It seems there are other very special species
as well. Wow Yo-kai are so deep!

161.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u3067[\u540c/\u304a\u:
Matching the same tribe in battle will give you
a [CR2]tribe bonus[C]!boosting your Yo-kai abilities!

163.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
Some Watchers, as well as Yo-kai techniques
and soultimate moves have [CR2]"elements"[C].

164.[\u5c5e\u6027/\u305e\u304f\u305b\u3044]\:
In all, there are 8 types of elements![CR2]Fire, water,
lightning, earth, ice, wind, light, darkness[C]!

165.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
Both Watchers and Yo-kai are [CR2]"resistant"[C] and
[CR2]"weak"[C] against specific elements.

166.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
The Watcher element is based on the Yo-kai Watch!
[CR2]Various elements[C] depend on the Watcher.

167.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u3067\u306f\u3000[CR2:
In battle, you can use [CR2]"Stop Watching"[C]
to check the element of an enemy.

168.[\u76f8\u624b/\u3042\u3044\u3066]\u306e\:
Aiming for the opponent's weak element,
is the best way to deal lots of damage!

170.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
Yo-kai can have many [CR2]personalities[C]. By changing
personality, the battle strategy will change.

171.\u305f\u3068\u3048\u3070\u3000\u300e\u30:
A "serious" and "calm" Yo-kai will be less likely
to loaf around and be more likely to use magic.

172.\u305f\u3068\u3048\u3070\u3000\u300e\u30:
For example, the "Lazy & Kind" Yo-kai
are easy to stun, but recover well.

173.[\u5f37/\u3064\u3088]\u304f\u3066\u3082\:
If the Yo-kai is strong but proned to loafing
you can always control it yourself!

175.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
As Yo-kai and Watchers continue to battle together,
the bound between the two will grow.

176.\u305d\u3057\u3066\u3000\u305d\u306e[\u5:
To a point where, for Yo-kai,Watcher can
become their [CR2]"favourite human"[C].

177.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
If Yo-kai battle with someone they like, their
[CR2]abilities will increase[C] and [CR2]loaf less[C].

178.\u3084\u3063\u3071\u308a\u3000[\u597d/\u:
After all, when you're in front of someone you like,
you want to show them your good side, don't you?

179.\u3057\u304b\u3082\u3000[\u5996\u602a/\u:
Some Yo-kai can even fall in love with more than
one person at a time! What? Is it allowed?

181.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
There are two types of Yo-kai "attitudes":
[CR2]"Ability"[C] and [CR2]"Personality"[C].

182.\u307e\u305a[CR2]\u300e\u305a\u307c\u308:
following this order: [CR2]Lazy ⇒ Carefree ⇒ Sure ⇒ Serious[C]
you will be harder to stun in battle.

183.\u3055\u307c\u308a\u306b\u304f\u3044[\u5:
If you want a resiliant Yo-kai,
make sure he has a "serious" attitude!

184.\u300e\u3053\u3046\u3069\u3046\u300f\u30:
There are 8 different types of attitude. When
Yo-kai move freely, [CR2]the way of fighting is affected[C].

185.[CR2]\u300e[\u77ed\u6c17/\u305f\u3093\u3:
[CR2]"Short-tempered"[C] uses the most basic inspirit.
[CR2]"Violent"[C] often uses physical attacks.

186.[CR2]\u300e[\u51b7\u9759/\u308c\u3044\u3:
[CR2]"Calm"[C] uses a lot of magical moves.
[CR2]"Disgusting"[C] uses debuff moves.

187.[CR2]\u300e[\u983c/\u305f\u306e]\u3082\u:
[CR2]"Reliable"[C] easily attracks the enemy.
[CR2]"Show-off"[C] fights aggressively while being aimed at.

188.[CR2]\u300e\u3084\u3055\u3057\u3044\u300:
[CR2]"Kind"[C] heal allies well.
[CR2]"Devoted"[C] uses buff moves.

189.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\: Check various things with the Yo-kai Pad!

190.[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u306e[\u4e2d/\u306:
Press <CMD_MENU> anywhere to open the [CR2]Yo-kai Pad[C].
The Yo-kai Pad features various [CR2]apps[C]!

191.\u30af\u30a8\u30b9\u30c8\u30a2\u30d7\u30:
Check the story progression using the Quests app
and use items with the inventory app.

192.\u30a2\u30d7\u30ea\u306f\u3000<CMD_FUNC4:
Apps can be [CR2]moved[C] with <CMD_FUNC4> . Customize
your Yo-kai Pad to your heart's content.

193.\u30a2\u30d7\u30ea\u304c[\u5897/\u3075]\:
As the number of apps increases, you will
have to turn the pages with <CMD_CHANGE_BACK1> <CMD_CHANGE_NEXT1> or [$gaiji_key_all_s100]!

194.[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u306e[\u4e2d/\u306:
Press<CMD_MENU>or<CMD_MENU_TOUCHPAD>anywhere to open the [CR2]Yo-kai Pad[C].
The Yo-kai Pad features various [CR2]apps[C]!

195.[\u65e5\u8a18/\u306b\u3063\u304d]\u30a2\: Frequently save using the diary app

196.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
When using the [CR2]diary app[C],
you can [CR2]save[C] your current progress.

197.[\u65e5\u8a18/\u306b\u3063\u304d]\u30a2\:
The diary app can be used by pressing <CMD_QUICK_SAVE> without
 to open the Yo-kai Pad with <CMD_MENU>! Convenient!

198.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000\u30c0\u30f3\u30:
However, you cannot save from the [CR2]diary app
in special places such as dungeons[C]!

199.\u307e\u305f\u3000\u30b2\u30fc\u30e0\u30:
An [CR2]"auto save"[C] feature also automatically save
at specific points while the game is in progress.

200.\u3046\u3063\u304b\u308a\u30bb\u30fc\u30:
"I inadvertently forgot to save!". In this case
you can resume directly from the autosave!

201.[\u65e5\u8a18/\u306b\u3063\u304d]\u30a2\:
The diary app can be used by pressing<CMD_QUICK_SAVE>or<CMD_MENU_TOUCHPAD>without
having to open the Yo-kai pad with <CMD_MENU>! Convenient!

202.\u30a6\u30ad\u30a6\u30ad\u30da\u30c7\u30: Become a Yo-kai specialist using Uikipedia!

203.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
The Yo-kai Pad [CR2]Uikipedia[C] allows you to read
information on Yo-kai and characters you met.

204.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
In case of Yo-kai, befriend them
to read more information.

205.[\u4eba\u9593/\u306b\u3093\u3052\u3093]\:
As for characters, the amount of information
increases as you progress through the story.

206.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
You can also take a closer look at the Yo-kai.
You can switch to the Shadowside form!

209.\u304a[\u5e97/\u307f\u305b]\u3084[\u5b9d:
Items you get at shops and treasure chests can be
seen on the [CR2]inventory app[C] on the Yo-kai Pad!

210.\u3082\u3061\u3082\u306e\u30a2\u30d7\u30:
You can also select items you have
and choose to [CR2] "Eat" [C] or [CR2]"Use"[C] them!

211.[CG2]\u30c1\u30e7\u30b3\u30dc\u30fc[C]\u:
As soon as you get a [CG2]Chocobar[C], you should
let me eat it! I'll be waiting nyan!

214.[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u306e[\u4e2d/\u306:
There are people in the city who need help.
[CR2]Let's take for example the "Tamagoto Quest"[C]!

215.\u305f\u306e\u307f\u3054\u3068\u30af\u30:
Those who need help, display a [$gaiji_mmap_quest03] landmark.
Let's talk and listen to what they have to say!

216.\u307f\u3054\u3068\u3000\u30af\u30a8\u30:
If you solve the quest brilliantly, you will receive
experience points and items as a reward!

217.\u30af\u30a8\u30b9\u30c8\u3092[\u5f15/\u:
After accepting the quest, press and hold <CMD_POS_FIXED_LOG_HOLD>.
You can also use [CR2]Naviwoof[C].

218.[\u753b\u9762/\u304c\u3081\u3093][\u53f3:
[$gaiji_mmap_quest02] will guide you to the quest destination, switching
the display at the top right of the screen.

219.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000[\u5929\u6c17/\u:
However, depending on the weather and hour,
you may not be able to reach your destination.

220.\u30af\u30a8\u30b9\u30c8\u306e\u30ca\u30:
If you want to stop the quest navigation
you can do it in the [CR2]quests app[C].

221.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
You can check various information
about the quest in quests app.

222.\u304a\u3059\u3059\u3081\u30ec\u30d9\u30:
As well as the recommended level and rewards.
Let's select the quest you want to proceed with!

224.\u3053\u306e[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u306b\:
This town is full of [CR2]"Mysterious Cases"[C] and it's
to the Yo-kai Detective Team to solve them!

225.\u30cd\u30c3\u30c8\u306e[\u602a\u5947/\u:
On the strange website called [CR2]"Mysterious Cases"[C],
posts about various mysteries can be read.

226.\u30aa\u30ec\u304c\u305d\u308c\u3092\u30:
Check and investigate them with the Y.S.D!
That's what [CR2]"Mysterious Cases"[C] are!

227.\u3046\u3059\u3089\u306c\u3089\u30af\u30:
These quests can be started in this room, from
[CR2]the detective agency's computer[C] more precisely!

228.[\u63a2\u5075\u4e8b\u52d9\u6240/\u305f\u:
Even if you don't go to the detective agency,
you can begin investigate via the [CR2]quests app[C].

231.[CR2]\u30e1\u30f3\u30d0\u30fc[\u7de8\u62:
Through the [CR2]member formation app[C], check Watchers
and Yo-kai abilities and organize participants.

232.[CR2]\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u30e1\u30f3\u30d:
Up to 3 Watchers and Yo-kai can participate
in battle via the [CR2]Battle Member[C] option.

233.\u3068\u3082\u3060\u3061[\u5996\u602a/\u:
With more Yo-kai, you can replace them battle.
The same applies to [CR2]"support members"[C].

234.\u30e1\u30f3\u30d0\u30fc[\u7de8\u6210/\u:
Select [CR2]"Members"[C] in the member formation
 app to replace the main members.

235.\u307e\u305f[CR2]\u300e\u30b9\u30bf\u30f:
Also, [CR2]"Set as Starter"[C] allows you
to start the battle by controlling the Yo-kai.

236.\u30e1\u30a4\u30f3\u30e1\u30f3\u30d0\u30:
The organization of your members is important!
If Yo-kai increase, check your party out!

238.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u306b[\u53c2\u52a0/\u:
In battle, you can only have [CR2]1 human Watcher[C]
who is the main participant.

239.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
If you want to replace a Watcher, use the
[CR2]Member Organization app[C] to do so!

240.\u307e\u305f\u3000\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30:
You can also switch with
[CR2]other Watchers[C] during a battle.

241.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
Watchers have different abilities
so let's use them all to our advantage!

242.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
You can also switch Watchers [CR2]in town[C]
and also directly control the chosen Watcher.

243.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
If you change the Watcher, you may find yourself
exploring the city with a fresh perspective!

246.\u30e1\u30f3\u30d0\u30fc[\u7de8\u6210/\u:
In the member formation, you can change
Watchers and Yo-kai [CR2]swords and moves[C].

247.[CR2]\u300e\u305d\u3046\u3073\u300f[C]\u:
[CR2]"Equipment"[C] such as weapons and armours, can be
set one by one for both Watchers and Yo-kai.

248.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
The Watcher's [CR2]"Move"[C] can be freely changed
if you learn new ones through the Watch skills.

249.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
However, Yo-kai only can when they level up
they will learn more and more skills.

250.\u305d\u3046\u3073\u30fb\u308f\u3056\u30:
Let's have the equipment ready before
the battle begins, firmly!

252.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
A Watcher ability learnt through the
Yo-kai Watch... This is a [CR2]Watch skill[C]!

253.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
Learn various moves and skills
with the [CR2]Watch Skill App[C].

254.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30b9\u30ad\u30:
[CR2]There are 6 types[C]: Yo-kai, Friend, Love, Mind,
Skill and Body. Each with unique characteristics.

255.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30b9\u30ad\u30:
When learning Watch skills, choose
between the 6 types through the app.

256.[\u6b21/\u3064\u304e]\u306b\u3000[\u899a:
Next, select the Watch skill you want to learn,
press and hold <CMD_ENTER> to learn a [CR2]Watch skill[C].

257.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000\u30a6\u30a9\u30:
However, [CR2]Watch points[C] are
required to learn Watch skills!

258.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30dd\u30a4\u30:
Watch points can be obtained gradually by
[CR2]leveling up[C], think carefully and use them!

259.\u307e\u305f\u3000[CR2][\u65b0/\u3042\u3:
You can also get a few Watch points
when [CR2]befriending a new Yo-kai[C]!

260.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
Learn a lot of Watch skills by looking for
various Yo-kai while leveling-up a Watcher.

262.[\u79c1/\u308f\u305f\u3057]\u3069\u3082\:
Oo oo oo! With [CR2]"Souls"[C], you can
befriend new Yo-kai by spending some!

263.\u300e[\u9b42/\u3053\u3093]\u300f\u306f\:
You can acquire [CR2]Souls[C]
in battles and at the Crank-a-Kai.

264.[CR2][\u9b42/\u3053\u3093]\u30ab\u30c4[\:
Afterwards, you can exchange those souls with
[CR2]Soul Konkatsu[C] to be introduced to a Yo-kai!

265.\u3055\u3089\u306b\u3000[\u5996\u602a/\u:
You can also use the Soul Counseling Center
 with the [CR2]Konkatsu App[C] on your Yo-kai Pad!

266.\u3068\u3082\u3060\u3061[\u5996\u602a/\u:
If you want me to help you make a new Yo-kai
friend, please select [CR2]"Matching"[C]! Oo oo oo♪

267.\u307e\u305a\u3000[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u:
But you need the correct soul type of a Yo-kai
in order for it to appear on the matching list.

268.\u3055\u3089\u306b[\u79c1/\u308f\u305f\u:
It is possible to meet mutiple Yo-kai
[CR2]friend candidates[C] at once.

269.\u30ec\u30d9\u30eb\u3084\u305b\u3044\u30:
Their levels and abilities may vary, so please
choose the one you like best!

270.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000[CR2]\u3068\u308:
Again, for [CR2]friend referrals[C], you will need the
correct souls and items for the Yo-kai to appear.

271.[\u7d39\u4ecb\u6761\u4ef6/\u3057\u3087\u:
Requirements vary depending on the Yo-kai strength.
Stronger Yo-kai have stricter conditions.

272.[\u7d39\u4ecb\u6761\u4ef6/\u3057\u3087\u:
Simply hand me souls and items required,
and I'll take care of the rest! Ho oo oo♪

273.\u304a[\u76f8\u624b/\u3042\u3044\u3066]\:
When it's all finished, the chosen Yo-kai
will officially become your [CR2]Yo-kai friend[C]!

274.\u304a\u3063\u3068\u3000\u30de\u30c3\u30:
Oo oo oops, there is also a small[CR2]referral fee[C]
needed. Thanks for your support!

275.[\u9b42/\u3053\u3093]\u30ab\u30c4[\u76f8: The Soul Counseling Center is here to help!

276.[\u9b42/\u3053\u3093]\u30ab\u30c4[\u76f8:
The Soul Counseling Center or app offers
numerous other ways to support your Yo-kai.

277.[CR2]\u300e\u305d\u3046\u3073\u30ab\u30b:
[CR2]Customize Equipment[C] allows you to create or
enhance [CR2]equipment[C] using souls and rare materials.

278.[\u4eba\u9593/\u306b\u3093\u3052\u3093]\:
You can make equipment for humans as well,
so seize the opportunity!

279.[CR2]\u300e[\u80b2\u6210/\u3044\u304f\u3:
The [CR2]Training[C] feature allows you to
increase the [CR2]six stats[C] of your Yo-kai.

280.\u305d\u308c\u305e\u308c\u306e[\u80fd\u5:
You will need the correct [CR2]tribe soul[C] and the
Yo-kai's [CR2]favourite food[C] to use this feature.

281.[CR2]\u300e[\u9b42\u4e00\u89a7/\u3053\u3:
The [CR2]Soul Catalog[C] option will allow you to view
or [CR2]exchange[C] souls for different soul types.

282.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
You can choose to group the Yo-kai's souls
by colour, rank, or tribe.

283.\u304a\u3063\u3068\uff01\u3000\u3044\u30:
Oo oo oops! There is also a [CR2]small fee[C]
charged for the service!

285.[CR2]\u30a2\u30fc\u30af[\u4ea4\u63db/\u3:
The [CR2]Trade App[C] allows you to trade
your Yo-kai Keystones with other players.

286.[CR2]\u300e[\u8fd1/\u3061\u304b]\u304f\u:
[CR2]Nearby Trade[C] allows you to trade
with local players in your vicinity.

287.[CR2]\u300e\u30d5\u30ec\u30f3\u30c9\u306:
[CR2]Friend Trade[C] allows you to trade with
a long-distance friend over the Internet.

288.\u30a2\u30fc\u30af\u3092[\u4ea4\u63db/\u:
Please be aware that traded Yo-kai
 will be [CR2]gone forever[C]!

289.\u3060\u3044\u3058\u306a[\u5996\u602a/\u:
Be careful when trading a Yo-kai Keystone and
make sure you pick right one! Oo oo oo!

290.[CR2]\u30a2\u30fc\u30af[\u4ea4\u63db/\u3:
The [CR2]Keystone Exchange App[C] also allows you to trade
your Yo-kai Keystones with your [CR2]friends[C].

291.[CR2]\u300e\u30d5\u30ec\u30f3\u30c9\u306: With [CR2]Friend Exchange[C] you can trade with a friend over the Internet.

294.[CR2]\u30a2\u30fc\u30af[\u9023\u52d5/\u3:
The [CR2]Keystone App[C] allows you
to scan your real-life Yo-kai Keystones!

295.[\u64cd\u4f5c/\u305d\u3046\u3055]\u306f\:
Simply scan the Keystones or the Sacred Armoury
above the [CR2]NFC area of the controller [C]!

296.\u3059\u308b\u3068\u3000\u30a2\u30fc\u30:
Then you can get various items
such as Keystones and souls!

297.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u2026\uff01\u3000[\u5:
However, a common Yo-kai Keystone
can only be read [CR2]once[C]!

298.[\u5996\u8056\u5263/\u3088\u3046\u305b\u:
Only special Keystones like the Sage Sword or
U Rarity ones can be [CR2]scanned everyday once[C].

299.\u30a2\u30fc\u30af[\u9023\u52d5/\u308c\u:
When scanning a Keystone, the game [CR2]will be
automatically saved[C], that's important!

300.\u307e\u305f\u3000[\u5b9f\u7269/\u3058\u:
Use your Keystone with the [CR2]Yo-kai Watch Arcane[C].
Next, scan it and you'll get a little surprise...

301.[\u4ed6/\u307b\u304b]\u306b\u3082\u3000\:
There are other Keystones rewarding you for
collecting them! The usage of Keystones is quite deep!

302.\u307e\u305a\u306f[CR2]\u300e[\u5996\u60:
First, download [CR2]"Yo-kai Watch 4++
Keystones Scanning App" [C] on your smartphone!

303.\u3042\u3068\u306f\u3000\u305d\u306e[\u9:
Use the scanning app to load up your smartphone
with the Keystone and the Sacred Armory!

305.[\u90f5\u4fbf\u5c40/\u3086\u3046\u3073\u: Get your deliveries with the Lambert Mail App!

306.[CR2]\u3053\u3084\u304e[\u90f5\u4fbf/\u3:
With the [CR2]Lambert Mail App[C], get items
delivered to you in a variety of ways!

307.[CR2]\u300e\u30c0\u30a6\u30f3\u30ed\u30f:
You can get items by entering a
[CR2]"Promotional Code"[C] or [CR2]"Love Phrases"[C].

308.\u30c0\u30a6\u30f3\u30ed\u30fc\u30c9[\u7:
For promotional codes, receive items by using 
[CR2]"Receive Delivery"[C].

309.\u300e\u304a[\u5c4a/\u3068\u3069]\u3051\:
Moreover, you may also be able to receive
other items from the "Delivered Items" service.

310.[CR2]\u300e\u30d7\u30ed\u30c0\u30af\u30c:
If you select [CR2]"Enter Product Code"[C], you can
enter the code number on the PlayStation Store.

311.\"PlayStation Store\"\u3067\u3000\u30b3\:
After entering the code in the PlayStation Store,
receive the item by clicking on [CR2]"Receive Delivery"[C].

312.[CR2]\u300e\u3042\u3044\u3053\u3068\u307:
In the [CR2]"Enter Secret Love Phrases"[C],
you can get items by entering a Love Phrase.

314.[\u8aac\u660e/\u305b\u3064\u3081\u3044]\:
Let me explain! What is this mysterious symbol
[CR2]"Mitchy Mark"[C] scattered throughout the world?!

315.\u300e<NAME_NATSUME_8>\u3055\u3093\u3092:
"The Mitchy Marks, watching over the pretty little
girl <NAME_NATSUME_8> from the shadows..."

317.\u30df\u30c4\u30de\u30bf\u30de\u30fc\u30:
The Mitchy Marks are hidden in many places!
Use [CR2]Watch Mode[C] to find them all!

318.[CR2]\u30df\u30c4\u30de\u30bf\u30de\u30f:
With the [CR2]Mitchy App[C], you can check
all the Mitchy marks you've found so far!

319.\u3055\u3089\u306b\u3000[\u51fa\u8840/\u:
And it's amazing! We can even find [CR2]hints[C]
of where the Mitchy Marks are located!

320.\u30df\u30c4\u30de\u30bf\u30de\u30fc\u30:
If you find any Mitchy Marks, report them to me! 
I'll be waiting for you at [CR2]<NAME_NATSUME_8>'s house[C]!

321.\u30df\u30c4\u30de\u30bf\u30de\u30fc\u30:
Depending on the number you find, you will
receive [CR2]luxury prizes[C] from Mitchy's Selection!

322.\u305f\u3060\u3057\uff01\u3000[\u8cde\u5:
However! The prize is [CR2]<NAME_NATSUME_8>'s exclusive [C]!
Be sure to speak on <NAME_NATSUME_8>'s behalf!

324.\u3053\u306e[\u4e16\u754c/\u305b\u304b\u:
This world, is filled with dreams, romance
and [CR2]"Treasures"[C] hidden in many places!

325.\u3053\u306e\u30df\u30fc\u304c\u3000\u30:
This me gives you the clue to
treasure stashes called a [CR2]"Treasure Photo"[C]!

326.\u307e\u305a\u306f[CR2]\u30c8\u30ec\u30b:
Check your photos in the [CR2]Treasure Photo App[C]!
Then use it as a hint to find the treasure!

327.\u30c8\u30ec\u30b8\u30e3\u30fc\u306e\u30:
When approaching the treasure location, [$gaiji_mmap_check01] will
appear. Press <CMD_ACT> and you'll get the treasure!

328.[\u65b0/\u3042\u305f\u3089]\u3057\u3044[:
If I find any new pictures, I'll share them
with you! If you see me [$gaiji_mmap_check01], give me a shout!

329.\u304a[\u6c17/\u304d]\u306b[\u5165/\u304: Add your favourite members to My Sets

330.\u30e1\u30f3\u30d0\u30fc[\u7de8\u6210/\u:
If you press <CMD_FUNC2> in the 'Main Member' section of
the Party App, you can set up [CR2]My Sets[C]!

331.\u30de\u30a4\u30bb\u30c3\u30c8\u3068\u30:
My Sets is a handy feature allowing you to [CR2]register[C]
your favourite members and [CR2]call them up[C] later!

332.\u307e\u305a\u306f\u3000\u30b9\u30ed\u30:
Select a slot and press [CR2] 'Register Current Member' [C]
to register the main member in your My Sets.

333.\u305d\u3057\u3066\u3000\u3059\u3067\u30:
If there is already a Set registered, you can change
the name by selecting [CR2]"My Set Name"[C].

334.\u30de\u30a4\u30bb\u30c3\u30c8\u306b\u30:
You can give any names to your set
and create all sorts of My Sets!

335.\u30e1\u30f3\u30d0\u30fc[\u7de8\u6210/\u:
You can use the <CMD_FUNC2> touchpad button to [CR2]My Set Settings[C]
in the "Main Member" section of the Member Organization application.

337.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\: Get Yo-kai Keystones from the Crank-a-Kai

338.[CR2][\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3:
The [CR2]Yo-kai Crank-a-Kai[C] contains
a variety of Yo-kai and items.

339.[CG2]\u30ac\u30b7\u30e3\u30b3\u30a4\u30f:
With [CG2]Crank-a-Coins[C], you can
to turn the Yo-kai Crank-a-Kai.

340.\u30ac\u30b7\u30e3\u3092\u307e\u308f\u30:
The game [CR2]will automatically save[C] when you turn
the Crank-a-Kai. Be sure to check before you turn!

341.\u30ac\u30b7\u30e3\u3092\u307e\u308f\u30:
The number of turns is limited every day.
It is said that you can turn it up to 30 [CR2]times[C]!

342.\u3055\u3089\u306b\u3000[\u5996\u602a/\u:
In addition to this town, there are several
other types of Yo-kai Crank-a-Kai!

345.[CR2]\u30ac\u30b7\u30e3\u30e9\u30f3\u30c:
In [CR2]Crank-a-Land[C], You can turn all kinds of
Yo-kai Crank-a-Kai from all over the world.

346.\u30a2\u30ca\u30bf\u304c\u3053\u308c\u30:
There are [CR2]4 Crank-a-Kai[C] in total: 3
you've found plus the Yo-kai World one!

347.\u30ac\u30b7\u30e3\u304c\u305f\u304f\u30:
It is convenient to have them all in one place!
I know what you're thinking, it's so obvious!♥

348.\u3055\u3089\u306b\u3055\u3089\u306b\uff:
If you have a [CG2]Crank-a-Point Card[C], you can
accumulate points by turning Crank-a-Kai!

349.\u30a2\u30ca\u30bf\u304c\u3000[\u4eca/\u:
I've already given you points for all turned
Crank-a-Kai so far, so don't worry.♪

350.[\u53d7\u4ed8/\u3046\u3051\u3064\u3051]\:
If you talk to Krystal Fox at the reception,
you can exchange your points for [CR2]prizes[C]!

351.\u305d\u3046\u305d\u3046\u266a\u3000[CR2:
There's also a [CR2]special points day[C]! On days
when it's 3, points earnt triple and 7, x7!

352.\u3067\u3082\u3067\u3082\u3000\u30dd\u30:
But even if it's not points day, I'd like you
to come and see me [CR2]every day[C]♥.

355.[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u306b\u306f\u3000\:
There are many [CR2]stores[C] in town, such as Everymart.
Each store carries a different type of product!

356.\u305f\u3079\u3082\u306e[\u4ee5\u5916/\u:
Convenient stores are not the only stores, when
you find one, be sure to check out their products!

357.\u30e8\u30ed\u30ba\u30de\u30fc\u30c8\u30:
At Everymart, you can not only buy items but
also [CR2]sell[C] items you don't need.

358.\u304a[\u5e97/\u307f\u305b]\u306e[\u5834:
You can also use the map screen, mini-map,
or compass to locate a store.

361.\u30ef\u30ec\u30ef\u30ec\u3000\u30df\u30:
The [CR2]Yo-Guru Salon[C] of the Mikakunin tribe can change
things which were never meant to be changed.

362.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
Yo-kai [CR2]attributes[C] and [CR2]feelings[C]
can be changed with your own power.

363.[\u4eba\u9593/\u306b\u3093\u3052\u3093]\:
For humans, you can [CR2]reset[C] the [CR2]"watch skill"[C].
Watch points are required to reset.

364.\u30bf\u30c0\u30b7\u3000\u30ef\u30ec\u30:
However, I won't change anything for free.
I want you to bring [CG2]Yo-Gourt[C] to me.

365.[\u5996/\u3088\u3046]\u30b0\u30eb\u30b5\:
Access the Yo-Guru Salon via the
[CR2]Crop Circle[C]. Thank You Very Much.

368.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u3067\u306f\u3000[\u5:
During battles, Yo-kai Watch user "Watcher"
and us Yo-kai are [CR2]fighting together[C] Nyan!

369.[\u6575/\u3066\u304d]\u306e[\u5996\u602a:
The battle against the Yo-kai enemy is called
[CR2]Action Battle[C]! [CR2]move[C] with [$gaiji_lst_s000] L-stick!

370.[\u6575/\u3066\u304d]\u306e[\u5996\u602a:
To fight the Yo-kai enemy, [CR2]"attack"[C] using <CMD_NORMAL_ATTACK>! 
Press it many times to continuously attack!

371.\u3082\u3061\u308d\u3093\u3000[\u6575/\u:
Of course, the Yo-kai enemy will also "attack"!
If you take damage, watch your [CR2]HP[C] out!

372.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb[\u4e2d/\u3061\u3085\u:
You can also press and hold <CMD_JUMP> to [CR2]dash[C]! 
Press <CMD_JUMP> a little to quickly [CR2]dodge[C]!

373.\u3046\u307e\u304f[\u4f7f/\u3064\u304b]\:
Use it well to avoid enemy's attack! But
dashing and dodging reduce your [CR2]stamina[C]!

374.\u30b9\u30bf\u30df\u30ca\u304c\u30bc\u30:
When stamina reaches zero, you get tired.
Your [CR2]movements slow down[C] so be careful!

375.[\u6575/\u3066\u304d]\u306e[\u5996\u602a:
Fight the Yo-kai nyenemy in [CR2]Action Battle[C]!
As usual,[$gaiji_lst_s000] to move with the [C]left stick[CR2]!

377.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
Every Watchers and Yo-kai magical
powers consumes [CR2]"YP"[C].

378.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
The Watcher consumes YP at the prompt of <CMD_NORMAL_ATTACK>.
When YP reaches zero, you [CR2]cannot attack[C]!

379.\u3057\u304b\u3057\u3000\u3054[\u5b89\u5:
But don't worry, press and hold <CMD_VACUUM>.
This is [CR2]Yo-kai Absorb[C]!

380.[\u5996\u6c17/\u3088\u3046\u304d]\u30b9\:
If you use the Yo-kai Absorb, you can absorb
the enemy soul [CR2]to recover your YP[C]!

381.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000[\u76f8\u624b/\u:
However, if you are far from the enemy,
you won't be able to do it, so be careful!

382.\u3053\u3046\u3052\u304d\u3068[\u5996\u6:
Carefully use attacks and Watch skills.
This is how to fight using the Yo-kai Watch!

383.\u3044\u308d\u3093\u306a\u308f\u3056\u30: Let's use all kinds of tricks!

384.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u3067\u306f\u3000<CMD:
In battle, in addition to <CMD_NORMAL_ATTACK> attacks, you can
also use <CMD_SKILL> to unleash [CR2]powerful attacks[C]!

385.\u308f\u3056\u3092[\u4f7f/\u3064\u304b]\:
Using this spell will consume a significant amount
of YP for both the Watcher and the Specter!

386.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
Yo-kai will [CR2]automatically recover[C] their YP, but
Watchers only with the Watch Steal!

387.\u308f\u3056\u306f\u3000\u3072\u3068\u30:
Pressing <CMD_SKILL_SELECT> will [CR2]switch[C] between
moves that can be used with <CMD_SKILL>!

388.[\u5207/\u304d]\u308a[\u66ff/\u304b]\u30:
The number of techniques you can switch between
will increase as you progress through the game!

391.[\u6575/\u3066\u304d]\u306e\u3053\u3046\:
Have you ever tried to avoid an enemy's attack
but didn't know when to move?

392.\u305d\u3093\u306a\u3068\u304d\u306f\u30:
If so, look at the enemy's [CR2]"attack sign"[C]!
If you look carefully, it'll be easier to avoid!

393.[\u5f37/\u3064\u3088]\u3044\u308f\u3056\:
A strong attack will also produce a [CR2]red attack
range[C] on the ground. Avoid it at any cost!

396.\u30aa\u30ec\u3063\u3061\u305f\u3061[\u5:
We, Yo-kai, are free and unrestrained. Sometimes
we even get tired of fighting each other.

397.\u3060\u304b\u3089\u3000\u30d0\u30c8\u30:
So if there are any Yo-kai loafing
during battle, please let them do.

398.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
The ease of loafing differs depending on the
Yo-kai "attitude". I want to skip this explanation.

399.\u30cb\u30e3\u30c3\u266a\u3000\u3069\u30:
Nyan♪ If you really don't want Yo-kai to loaf
around, you can control them yourself. It's solved!

402.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
Yo-kai are commonly summoned to battle,
but they should still be praised!

403.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
If you press <CMD_RESERVE_CHANGE> at the right moment,
you can praise the Yo-kai. I'll be cheering you on!

404.\u300c\u3084\u308b\u3058\u3083\u3093\uff:
Praising will motivate us, boost ourspeed,
and make it harder for us to loaf.

405.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
By controlling a Yo-kai, you can tell the Watcher
to praise me. I'll give you a compliment too!

408.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u3067\u306f\u3000[\u4: In battle, [CR2]Yo-kai and Watchers[C] can be switched.

409.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb[\u4e2d/\u3061\u3085\u:
Press [$gaiji_key_all_s200] to play with a [CR2]Yo-kai[C]!
Of course, you can also play with the Watcher.

410.\u307e\u305f\u3000[\u6575/\u3066\u304d]\:
Sometimes, it can be scary to fight
multiple Yo-kai enemies at the same time.

411.<CMD_TARGET_LOCK_ON>\uff32\u30b9\u30c6\u:
If you press the R stick button <CMD_TARGET_LOCK_ON>
you can attack nearby enemies using [CR2]target lock[C]!

412.[$gaiji_key_all_s100]\u3092[\u62bc/\u304:
Press [$gaiji_key_all_s100] to [CR2]switch target locks[C].
[$gaiji_rst_s000] It's OK to knock down the R stick a little!

413.[\u56de\u5fa9/\u304b\u3044\u3075\u304f]\:
You can also target [CR2]allies[C] if
you can use healing and support moves.

414.\u3053\u306e\u3068\u304d\u3000<CMD_TARGE:
If you press the <CMD_TARGET_FRIEND> L stick button,
only [CR2]allies can be targeted[C] in order. Convenient!

415.[\u64cd\u4f5c/\u305d\u3046\u3055]\u3068\:
Get used to leader and target changing
to improve your skills in battle!

416.<CMD_TARGET_LOCK_ON>\uff32\uff13\u30dc\u:
Pressing the <CMD_TARGET_LOCK_ON> R3 button will lock onto
the nearest enemy [CR2]target[C], ensuring you can hit it!

417.[$gaiji_key_all_s100]\u3092[\u62bc/\u304:
By pressing [$gaiji_key_all_s100], you can [CR2]switch[C] the target lock.
You can also move the [$gaiji_rst_s000] right stick a little bit.

418.\u3053\u306e\u3068\u304d\u3000<CMD_TARGE:
Press the <CMD_TARGET_FRIEND> L3 button to [CR2]target
allies in turn[C], which is very convenient!

419.[\u6575/\u3066\u304d]\u3092\u306d\u3089\: Aim the target pin at the enemy

420.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb[\u4e2d/\u3061\u3085\u:
During battle, you can press and hold <CMD_AIM>
to carefully [CR2]"aim at your opponent"[C].

421.[\u6575/\u3066\u304d]\u3092\u306d\u3089\:
Press <CMD_PIN_THROW> when you're aiming at
an enemy to stick the [CR2]target pin[C] onto it!

422.\u30bf\u30fc\u30b2\u30c3\u30c8\u30d4\u30:
When you stick a target pin, all party members
will [CR2]focus[C] on the enemy you pinned.

423.\u307e\u305f\u3000\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb[\u4:
Also, during battles, a [CR2]"Wandering Orb"[C]
may be floating around.

424.\u3055\u3059\u3089\u3044[\u7389/\u3060\u:
If you aim at the wandering ball, use the target pin,
to get [CR2]rare items[C] at the end of the battle!

425.[\u7d4c\u9a13\u5024/\u3051\u3044\u3051\u:
Experience and money will be doubled too!
If you find a wandering orb, aim for it!

428.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb[\u4e2d/\u3061\u3085\u:
As time goes by during the battle,
the Yo-kai [CR2]Deadly G[C] will accumulate!

429.\u3072\u3063\u3055\u3064\u30b2\u30fc\u30:
When the Deadly G is full, press <CMD_SUPECIAL_SKILL> to make
a Yo-kai [CR2]Deadly[C] and temporarily become stronger!

430.\u30b0\u30ec\u30fc\u30c8[\u5316/\u304b]\:
While deadly, use your [CR2]Deathblow[C]
by pressing <CMD_SUPECIAL_SKILL>!

431.\u3057\u304b\u3082\u3000\u30bf\u30a4\u30:
The more you press the button at the right time,
the more the [CR2]tension rises[C] for a deadly blow!

432.\u305f\u3060\u3057\uff01\u3000[\u4e00\u5:
But you can only use it once
[CR2]so do not miss your chance[C]!

434.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
Some Yo-kai have different forms called
[CR2]Lightside[C] and [CR2]Shadowside[C].

435.\u305d\u306e\u3088\u3046\u306a[\u5996\u6:
If such Yo-kai are in your group, they will
always [CR2]start the battle on the light side[C].

436.\u3057\u304b\u3057\u2026\u3000\u3072\u30:
When your [CR2]Special Move Gauge[C] is at its maximum,
press <CMD_SUPECIAL_SKILL> to change to Shadowside!

437.\u30e9\u30a4\u30c8\u30b5\u30a4\u30c9\u30:
During Lightside, the Yo-kai's form will change.
Attacks and abilities will also change greatly!

438.\u30b7\u30e3\u30c9\u30a6\u30b5\u30a4\u30:
When you're on the Shadowside,you can
also use [CR2]powerful attacks[C] by pressing <CMD_SUPECIAL_SKILL>!

439.\u30b0\u30ec\u30fc\u30c8[\u5316/\u304b]\:
However, the Shadowside effects will
disappear after a certain amount of time.

442.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
Just like Yo-kai, Watchers also have
their own special deathblow!

443.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
You can [CR2]immediately use it[C] by pressing [CMD_SUPECIAL_SKILL]
at the same time when your attack gauge is full.

444.\u3055\u3089\u306b\u3000\u30a6\u30a9\u30:
In addition, the Watcher's deathblow seems to
 differ from one Watcher to another.

445.[CR2]\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30b9\u30a:
You can also [CR2]enhance your watch skills[C].
Let's see how much stronger you all can get.

448.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
Some Yo-kai moves and techniques
have [CR2] "alteration" [C] effects.

449.[CR2][\u826f/\u3088]\u3044\u3068\u308a\u:
When [CR2]good alterations[C] kicks in,
your individual stats will buff.

450.[CR2][\u60aa/\u308f\u308b]\u3044\u3068\u:
On the contrary, [CR2]bad alterations[C]
will debuff your individual stats.

451.\u3068\u308a\u3064\u304d\u306f\u3000[CR2:
The alteration will stop [CR2]after a moment[C].
[CR2]Buff or cure alteration[C] using an item.

452.[\u77f3\u5316/\u305b\u304d\u304b]\u306a\:
You can release from petrification by quickly
moving the stick or hitting buttons repeatedly.

453.\uff12[\u7a2e\u985e/\u3057\u3085\u308b\u:
Both types of aliteration are super powerful
when mastered! Be smart using them!

456.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb[\u4e2d/\u3061\u3085\u:
If you punch or defeat an enemy during battle,
it may lose a [CR2]"Recovery Ball"[C]!

457.[\u7dd1/\u307f\u3069\u308a]\u306e[\u56de:
The green one restores [CR2]HP[C], the blue one restores [CR2]YP[C]
 and the yellow one restores [CR2]Deathblow Gauge[C]!

458.\u30d4\u30f3\u30c1\u306e\u3068\u304d\u30:
In a bad situation, pick up a recovery ball and
you might be able to turn things around.

461.[\u6575/\u3066\u304d]\u306e[\u5996\u602a:
Continue to attack enemies to defeat them,
and they may enter a state of [CR2]"faintness"[C].

462.\u3053\u308c\u3053\u305d\u304c\u3000[CR2:
This is your chance to [CR2]extract a soul[C]!
Get close to your opponent and press <CMD_RESERVE_CHANGE>!

463.\u3053\u3093\u3059\u3044[\u72b6\u614b/\u:
However, there is a [CR2]time limit[C].
Don't miss this opportunity and let's go for it!

464.<CMD_VACUUM>[\u9577\u62bc/\u306a\u304c\u:
Press and hold <CMD_VACUUM> to hit [CR2] "Soul Extraction" [C]!
You'll get the soul of the monster!

465.[\u9b42/\u3053\u3093]\u306f\u3000[CR2][\:
There are three types of souls: [CR2]white, red and gold[C].
If you get a gold soul, you'll be super lucky!

466.[\u4ea4\u4ee3/\u3053\u3046\u305f\u3044]\: Change and Follow-up to Hit hard!

467.[\u4ef2\u9593/\u306a\u304b\u307e]\u306e\:
When your friends HP is low or the battle is over,
the support members will [CR2]"appeal for action"[C]!

468.\u3053\u3046\u305f\u3044\u30a2\u30d4\u30:
During the appeal, you can switch to a
different member by pressing and holding <CMD_RESERVE_CHANGE>.

469.\u3072\u304b\u3048\u30e1\u30f3\u30d0\u30:
It's not just about taking turns.
They can also [CR2]"attack"[C] during battle!

470.[\u6575/\u3066\u304d]\u3092\u3053\u3046\:
If you are attacking an enemy, you may get an
[CR2]Attack Chance[C] from the Yo-kai.

471.[\u5236\u9650\u6642\u9593\u5185/\u305b\u:
Press <CMD_RESERVE_CHANGE> within the time limit to land
a [CR2]successful[C] attack! Otherwise, you'll fail!

472.\u3064\u3044\u3052\u304d\u306f\u3000[\u5:
Follow-up attacks will always deal [CR2]Critical Damage[C]
and can make the enemy [CR2]Faint[C]!

474.\u30b9\u30c8\u30c3\u30d7\u30a6\u30a9\u30: What Stop Watching can do for you

475.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u3092[\u6b62/\u3068]\:
If you want to stop the battle and take a closer
look at what's happening, use [CR2]Stop Watching[C]!

476.\u30b9\u30c8\u30c3\u30d7\u30a6\u30a9\u30:
Select Stop Watching immediately after starting
a battle, or by pressing <CMD_STOP_WATCHING> during a battle.

477.<CMD_STOP_WATCHING_SELECT_PARTY_UP>\u309:
Press <CMD_STOP_WATCHING_SELECT_PARTY_UP> to read [CR2]companion information[C].
 Read and switch between [CR2]enemy information[C] with <CMD_STOP_WATCHING_SELECT_ENEMY_UP>.

478.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
You'll also find out what elements
your Yo-kai are good or bad at!

479.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000[\u6575/\u3066\u:
To find out the element of an enemy, you must
either defeat or damage him with that attribute.

480.\u30b9\u30c8\u30c3\u30d7\u30a6\u30a9\u30:
Use the command [CR2]at the bottom right of the
screen[C] to do various things in stopwatching.

481.[CR2]\u300e\u30bf\u30fc\u30b2\u30c3\u30c:
The [CR2]"Target Pin"[C] allows you to choose your
enemy and then stab him with it.

482.[CR2]\u300e\u3082\u3061\u3082\u306e\u300:
Using [CR2]Inventory Items[C], you can use
items such as food.

483.[CR2]\u300e\u30e1\u30f3\u30d0\u30fc[\u4e:
The [CR2]"Switch Member"[C] button allows you to switch
to anotherWatcher or Yo-kai on your team.

484.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000\u30a2\u30a4\u30:
However, after using an item or changing
members, you will need to wait a while.

485.\u30b9\u30c8\u30c3\u30d7\u30a6\u30a9\u30:
Stop Watching can be selected immediately after the battle starts
or by pressing the <CMD_STOP_WATCHING> button during a battle.

486.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u30e1\u30f3\u30d0\u30: Fainting and Game Over in Battle

487.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u30e1\u30f3\u30d0\u30:
If a battle member's HP drops to zero, they will
[CR2]"Faint"[C] and will be unable to move or attack!

488.[\u6c17\u7d76/\u304d\u305c\u3064]\u306f\:
When fainting, recover using [CG2]resurrection items[C] and
perform [CR2]quick actions[C].

489.\u307e\u305f\u3000\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u30:
Also, if all party members are knocked out,
the battle will count as a [CR2]"Game Over"[C]!

490.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u306b\u3000[\u6557\u5:
If you lose, you can return to the [CR2]previous save[C]
 before the battle and retry.

492.[\u52dd/\u304b]\u3066\u306a\u3044\u3068\: If you can't win, run or forfeit!

493.\u3068\u3093\u3067\u3082\u306a\u3044[\u5:
You can quickly [CR2]"escape"[C] if there is a
strong enemy or want to quit the battle.

494.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u306e\u30a8\u30ea\u30:
If you run toward the edge of the battle
area, the [CR2]escape gauge[C] will increase.

495.[\u9003\u8d70/\u3068\u3046\u305d\u3046]\:
You can safely escape with a maxed gauge.
You'll lose everything you got in battle!

496.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000\u30b9\u30c8\u30:
However, story and quest battles are
impossible to escape!

497.[\u9003/\u306b]\u3052\u3089\u308c\u306a\:
If you can't win a battle you can't
escape from, you should [CR2]"forfeit"[C]!

498.[CR2]\u30b9\u30c8\u30c3\u30d7\u30a6\u30a:
If you press <CMD_STOP_WATCHING_GIVEUP> during [CR2]Stop Watching[C], you can
 surrender and start over from before the battle.

499.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000[\u964d\u53c2/\u:
However, surrender is the same as defeat
so be careful if you don't want to lose anything!

501.\u30aa\u30fc\u30c8\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb\u30: Let the auto-battle do all the work

502.\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb[\u4e2d/\u3061\u3085\u:
Pressing <CMD_AUTO_BATTLE> during a battle will [CR2]Auto Battle[C].
Characters will be automatically controlled.

503.\u30a2\u30af\u30b7\u30e7\u30f3\u30d0\u30:
If you're not a fan of action battles or want to end
a battle with a weak enemy, this is for you!

504.\u30aa\u30fc\u30c8\u30d0\u30c8\u30eb[\u4:
Some operations such as <CMD_STOP_WATCHING> Stop Watching and
<CMD_RESERVE_CHANGE> follow-up are still possible during auto-battle.

505.\u3082\u3046[\u4e00\u5ea6/\u3044\u3061\u:
Just press <CMD_AUTO_BATTLE> again and you'll be back in control.
Take advantage of Auto-Battle without worries!

507.\u307f\u306a\u3055\u3093\u306e\u30d0\u30:
While you're battling, I'm going to do [CR2]Yo-kai Net
Shopping[C]to order some very useful [CG2]battle items[C]!

508.[\u983c/\u305f\u306e]\u3093\u3060\u30d0\:
Ordered battle items will be delivered by [CG2]drone[C]!
You can also see drone's delivery status on screen!

509.\u3069\u308d\uff5e\u3093\u304c[\u5230\u7:
When the drone arrives, he will place battle items
on the battlefield, so feel free to use them!

510.\u306a\u3093\u304b[\u5149/\u3072\u304b]\:
A glowing ball will appear from a [CG2]Suspicious Vase[C].
Eat the [CG2]mysterious konpeito[C] to be invicible...

511.\u307e\u3042\u3000\u305f\u3076\u3093[\u5:
Well, it's probably a good one, so go
ahead and use it! It's fine! I think so!

512.\u30e4\u30d0\u3044\u30dc\u30b9\u306e\u30:
Especially against difficult boss battles! Okay,
let me browse the Yo-kai-Net and buy some more!

513.[\u5996\u602a\u5927\u76f8\u64b2/\u3088\u: Enter the Yo-kai Grand Sumo Tournament!

514.[\u5996\u602a\u5927\u76f8\u64b2/\u3088\u:
Anyone can [CR2]"enter"[C] the Yo-kai Grand Sumo
Tournament but [CR2]there are several rules[C].

515.\u307e\u305a\u3000[\u5996\u602a\u5927\u7:
Only a Watcher and 3 main Yo-kai from
[CR2]Battle Members[C] are allowed to participate.

516.\u3064\u307e\u308a\u3000[CR2]\u3072\u304:
In other words, 3 [CR2]Support Yo-kai cannot
compete[C] in the Grand Sumo Tournament!

517.[\u4ed6/\u307b\u304b]\u306b\u3082\u3000[:
There is also a [CR2]special rule[C] sometimes
restricting the
rank and tribe of participating Yo-kai.

518.[\u5996\u602a\u5927\u76f8\u64b2/\u3088\u:
Now, go win some of the Yo-kai Grand
Sumo Tournaments and unleash your amazing power!

519.\u300e[\u672c\u5834\u6240/\u307b\u3093\u: Let's fight to the end of this tournament!

520.[\u672c\u5834\u6240/\u307b\u3093\u3070\u:
When you enter a tournament, you have a set
[CR2]number of sumo battles[C] in a row to perform.

521.\u305d\u3057\u3066\u3000[\u6700\u5f8c/\u:
The basic principle of sumo is to [CR2]compete
to the end[C] with the other participants.

522.[\u5834\u6240/\u3070\u3057\u3087]\u3054\:
Meet the [CR2]conditions[C] to enter the tournament.
The one with the most victories is the [CR2]"Champion"[C]!

523.[\u672c\u5834\u6240/\u307b\u3093\u3070\u:
Sumo battles will vary depending on the tournament.
The higher thetournament level, the harder.

524.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000[\u76f8\u64b2/\u:
However, if there are plenty of battles,
you can take a break and [CR2]suspend[C].

525.[\u4e2d\u65ad/\u3061\u3085\u3046\u3060\u:
This will allow you to save and replace your team.
You can [CR2]resume[C] at the reception desk.

526.[\u672c\u5834\u6240/\u307b\u3093\u3070\u:
You can also [CR2]retire[C] from the main tournament...
but you will fight to the end, won't you?

528.[\u5996\u602a\u5927\u76f8\u64b2/\u3088\u:
fight your way through the Tournament to earn
[CR2]Gottsuan Points(GP)[C] and [CR2]Sumo Experience[C]!

529.\uff27\uff30\u306f\u3000[\u7279\u5225/\u:
GPs are points to be exchanged for [CR2]special prizes[C].
Promote to the [CR2]"Banzuke" rank[C] with experience.

530.\uff27\uff30\u3068[\u76f8\u64b2\u7d4c\u9:
Both are available at the end of the [CR2]battle[C].
The more battles you win, the more points you get!

531.\u3055\u3089\u306b\u3000[CR2][\u672c\u58:
In addition, if you [CR2]clear the main tournament[C],
you will receive  more GP and sumo experience!

532.[\u53d6\u7d44/\u3068\u308a\u304f\u307f]\:
If you win the tournament, you'll also get
the usual rewards for your battle members.

534.\u305f\u307e\u3063\u305f\uff27\uff30\u30:
To exchange your accumulated GPs, go to [CR2]"Yo-kai Exchange"[C]
next to the reception desk and ask for [CG2]Dismarelda[C].

535.[\u6211/\u308f]\u304c[\u5996\u602a\u8a55:
Our Council of Yo-kai has prepared various prizes.
Also, [CR2]rare Yo-kai souls[C] are only available here.

536.[\u4ea4\u63db/\u3053\u3046\u304b\u3093]\:
The more [CR2]main Tournaments[C] you win, the more
prizes you can redeem will be added.

537.\u3061\u306a\u307f\u306b\u3000[\u53d7\u4:
On the other side of the reception area,
[CG2]Hapierre[C] is running a [CR2]Yo-kai shop[C].

538.[\u5927\u76f8\u64b2/\u304a\u304a\u305a\u:
Useful items to be used in battle are available.
 It's a good place to get ready for the tournament.

539.[\u76f8\u64b2\u7d4c\u9a13\u5024/\u3059\u: Raise your Sumo experience and become a Yokozuna!

540.[\u76f8\u64b2/\u3059\u3082\u3046]\u30d0\:
As a watcher accumulates sumo experience,
he or she will be [CR2]"promoted" to a higher rank[C].

541.[\u756a\u4ed8/\u3070\u3093\u3065\u3051]\:
Banzuke is the ranking of wrestlers in
the Yo-kai Grand Sumo Tournament.

542.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
[CR2]Each Watcher[C] gains sumo experience
and is promoted to a different rank.

543.[\u4e0a\u4f4d/\u3058\u3087\u3046\u3044]\:
The number of matches [CR2]completed and won[C]
are required for promotion to the higher rankings.

544.[\u5996\u602a\u5927\u76f8\u64b2/\u3088\u:
Let's master the Yo-kai Grand Sumo Tournament and
aim to the "Yokozuna Promotion" for all "Watchers"!

545.[\u5996\u602a\u5927\u76f8\u64b2/\u3088\u: The rank order of the YGST

546.[\u5996\u602a\u5927\u76f8\u64b2/\u3088\u:
There are a total of 10 ranks starting from "Ozeki"
and ending with "Yokozuna", the highest rank.

547.[\u7279/\u3068\u304f]\u306b\u300e[\u5927:
To promote from Ozeki to Yokozuna,
more sumo experience will be required...

548.\u3060\u304c\u3000[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u:
But of course, Lord Enma,
[CR2]the greatest Yo-kai[C], is the sumo master!

549.[\u571f\u4ff5\u4e0a/\u3069\u3072\u3087\u: A hot battle in the ring. A sumo battle!

550.[\u529b\u58eb/\u308a\u304d\u3057]\u305f\:
The sumo wrestlers fight in a smaller area
[CR2]on the ring[C] than in normal battles.

551.\u305d\u3057\u3066\u3000[\u76f8\u64b2/\u:
A sumo battle is not just a matter of reducing the
opponent's HP to zero and defeating him as usual.

552.[CR2][\u571f\u4ff5/\u3069\u3072\u3087\u3:
You have to defeat Yo-kai by [CR2]dropping
them outside of the ring[C]. After all, this is "sumo"!

553.\u305d\u3057\u3066\u3000[\u76f8\u624b/\u:
If you can get every opponents out of the ring,
you win the match! You'll receive a [CR2]"White Star"[C].

554.\u3082\u3061\u308d\u3093\u3000[\u5473\u6:
If all of your team are knocked out of the ring,
you'll lose and receive a [CR2]"black star"[C].

555.\u305d\u3057\u3066[\u5996\u602a\u5927\u7:
And in sumo, if you're thrown out of the ring
you [CR2]can't come back in[C]! Don't let your guard down!

556.[\u571f\u4ff5/\u3069\u3072\u3087\u3046]\: Get your opponent out of the ring!

557.[\u5927\u76f8\u64b2/\u304a\u304a\u305a\u:
Sumo wrestling is all about how to get out of the ring.
This is where the [CR2]"Knockback"[C] comes into play.

558.[\u571f\u4ff5/\u3069\u3072\u3087\u3046]\:
Being attacked while in the ring is a.
[CR2]"knockback"[C] which can drop you out of the ring!

559.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000\u30ce\u30c3\u30:
But if the opponent has too much HP remaining,
he will [CR2]stay on the edge of the ring[C]!

560.\u307e\u305f\u3000[\u76f8\u64b2/\u3059\u:
Also, if you attack an opponent repeatedly
in a sumo battle, he will enter a [CR2]Staggered State[C].

561.\u3075\u3089\u3075\u3089[\u72b6\u614b/\u:
Hit a staggered opponent with [CR2]multiple
attacks[C] to [CR2]drop him[2] out of the ring!

562.\u3075\u3089\u3075\u3089[\u72b6\u614b/\u:
This can be done with [CR2]effective attributes[C].
With [CR2]Zero HP[C], it will definitely happen!

563.\uff28\uff30\u3092\u30bc\u30ed\u306b\u30:
Even with Zero HP, the opponent can recover
while staggered. Don't miss your chance!

564.\u300e\u30ce\u30c3\u30af\u30d0\u30c3\u30:
Knock back the opponent and try to hit him...
That's how you fight in a sumo battle...

565.\u3069\u3059\u3053\u3044\u30b2\u30fc\u30: Check the battle status with the Sumo Gauge!

566.[\u76f8\u64b2/\u3059\u3082\u3046]\u30d0\:
During a sumo battle, the [CR2]"sumo gauge"[C]
is always displayed at the top of the screen.

567.\u3069\u3059\u3053\u3044\u30b2\u30fc\u30:
It shows you at a glance whether
[CR2]you or your opponent[C] have the upper hand.

568.\u3069\u3059\u3053\u3044\u30b2\u30fc\u30:
The sumo gauge changes depending on the
number of participants and their remaining HP.

569.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\: Just you and your Yo-kai, Busters++!

570.[\u5730\u7344/\u3058\u3054\u304f]\u306e\:
From the Buster's Gate of Inferno and beyond
the World, [CR2]Busters++[C] is ready to dispatch!

571.\u30d0\u30b9\u30bf\u30fc\u30ba\u306f\u30:
Busters++ is a special mission for your Yo-kai!
You'll be sent out with up to four [CR2]Yo-kai[C].

572.\u3064\u307e\u308a\u3000[\u4eba\u9593/\u:
We can't send them out with the [CR2]Watchers[C]!
They'll have to play a different role in the mission!

573.\u305d\u3057\u3066\u30d0\u30b9\u30bf\u30:
In Busters, you're just a bunch of newcomers!
You'll never be as strong as you usually are!

574.\u30d0\u30b9\u30bf\u30fc\u30ba\u3067\u30:
Your strength in Busters is the [CR2]"Buster's Level"[C]!
Every Yo-kai start from Level 1!

575.[\u5730\u7344/\u3058\u3054\u304f]\u306e[:
From the depths of Inferno, the Busters++ are
on the move! Let's go, team! Go Busters++!

576.\u30d0\u30b9\u30bf\u30fc\u30ba\u30df\u30: Let's go on a Busters mission!

577.[CR2]\u30df\u30c3\u30b7\u30e7\u30f3\u306:
To go on a [CR2]mission[C], go to Buster's Inferno
Base and talk to me, Sgt. Burly!

578.\u30ea\u30b9\u30c8\u304b\u3089\u3000\u30:
Select a mission from the list then [CR2]"Move out!"[C]!
You can also just press <CMD_BUSTERS_READY>!

579.[\u51fa\u52d5\u5f85\u6a5f/\u3057\u3085\u:
You can also change the team members standby screen.
Don't panic if you've already chosen your mission!

580.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000[\u51fa\u52d5\u5:
When you are on standby for deploymen,
you won't be able to change [CR2]Yo-kai equipments[C]!

581.\u30df\u30c3\u30b7\u30e7\u30f3\u304b\u30:
When returning from a mission, you'll be in standby.
Press <CMD_FUNC4> [CR2]to select the next mission[C].

582.\u305d\u3057\u3066\u3000\u30df\u30c3\u30:
The more missions you complete,
the more your [CR2]"Busters Rank"[C] increases!

583.\u30d0\u30b9\u30bf\u30fc\u30ba\u30e9\u30:
The higher your Busters rank, the more missions
you'll be able to choose from!

584.[\u4f4e/\u3066\u3044]\u30e9\u30f3\u30af\:
If you're low rank, you'll have
to complete the [CR2]main mission to level up[C]!

586.\u30df\u30c3\u30b7\u30e7\u30f3\u306b[\u5:
To organize [CR2]members[C] to go on a mission,
 this is where I, [CG2]Happierre[C], come in!

587.[\u51fa\u52d5/\u3057\u3085\u3064\u3069\u:
You can choose up to [CR2]4 Yo-kai to deploy[C].
You can't use [CR2]Watchers[C], so be careful!

588.\u305d\u308c\u3068\u3000[\u5996\u602a/\u:
Also, the [CR2]effect of a Yo-kai's move[C]
may change in Busters, so watch carefully.

589.\u3053\u3053\u3067\u306f\u3000\u30e1\u30:
You can change the [CR2]members equipment[C]
and the members formation.

590.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
You can use the same weapons and armours
[CR2]used in your regular battles[C]!

591.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
Choose your Yo-kai and Sobi carefully,
and challenge the mission with the perfect team!

592.[\u9b3c\u7389/\u304a\u306b\u3060\u307e]\: Raise your Buster's level with Oni Orbs!

593.[CR2]\u30d0\u30b9\u30bf\u30fc\u30ba\u30e:
If you want to raise your [CR2]Buster's Level[C],
the [CG2]coach Nekidspeed[C] will train them for you!

594.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000[\u7279\u8a13/\u:
To raise the Buster's Level through training
you need [CR2]Oni Orbs[C] you can get from missions!

595.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\:
Press <CMD_ENTER> to use Oni Orbs to get [CR2]experience[C]!
once enough experience accumulated, you'll level up!

596.<CMD_ENTER>\u3092[\u62bc/\u304a]\u3057[\:
Hold <CMD_ENTER> to [CR2]level up[C] at once!
Can you keep up with me and my intense training?

597.[\u9b3c\u7389/\u304a\u306b\u3060\u307e]\: Buy various items with your Oni Orbs!

598.[CG2]\u30b8\u30df\u30fc[C]\u306a\u30dc\u:
The [CR2]Dimmy[C] Shop, run by [CR2]Dimmy[C] himself,
has come to Inferno Base on a Dimmy business trip.

599.\u3053\u306e\u30b8\u30df\u30fc\u30b7\u30:
In this Dimmy Shop, you can use
[CR2]Oni Orbs[C] to buy various items.

600.\u3067\u3093\u3058\u3093[\u89aa\u65b9/\u:
You'll also find some strange weapons
Signiton has made for you...

601.[\u58f2/\u3046]\u3063\u3066\u308b\u305d\:
You can use the [CR2]"Customize equipment"[C]
of the Soul Cut to enhance the weapons you buy.

602.\u3042\u3068\u3000[CG2][\u9b3c/\u304a\u3:
Bring an item called [CG2]Oni Egg[C],
I'll buy it and exchange it for [CR2]Oni Orbs[C].

604.\u3053\u306e[\u5730\u7344\u57fa\u5730/\u:
In this Hell base, you can turn a [CR2]"Oni Crank-a-Kai"[C]
which gives you special Yo-kai and items!

605.[\u57fa\u5730/\u304d\u3061]\u3092[\u4f5c:
It seems this place was abandoned before we
built the base. I've done some quick repairs! Hahaha!

606.[\u9b3c/\u304a\u306b]\u30ac\u30b7\u30e3\:
To turn the Oni Crank-a-Kai, you'll need
special [CG2]Oni Crank-a-Coins[C], not regular coins!

607.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000[\u9b3c/\u304a\u:
However, the Oni Crank-a-Kai can only
be turned a few times a day!

609.[CR2][\u901a\u4fe1\u6a5f\u80fd/\u3064\u3:
If you use the [CR2]communication function[C],
you can play Busters with up to 4 friends.

610.[\u968a\u9577/\u305f\u3044\u3061\u3087\u:
Talk to the captain and select [CR2]"Online Play"[C]
to play with someone from far away.

611.\u3044\u3063\u3057\u3087\u306b\u30d7\u30:
To be friends with someone after a mission,
[CR2]register the friend[C] on the console.

612.[CR2]\u300e[\u8fd1/\u3061\u304b]\u304f\u:
[CR2]"Deploy with Nearby People"[C] to play with
anyone in your vicinity via local communication.

613.\u3048\u3063\u2026\u3000\u30e1\u30f3\u30:
What... there aren't that many members?
Well, you'll be [CR2]accompanied by a Yo-kai[C].

614.[\uff12\u4eba/\u3075\u305f\u308a]\u3067\:
Each of the 2 players will have their [CR2]own Yo-kai[C],
and if 3, the [CR2]leader will have one Yo-kai[C].

615.\u304a\u3068\u3082[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u:
The [CR2]second Yo-kai[C] will automatically be
chosen from your Busters team.

616.\u30de\u30eb\u30c1\u30d7\u30ec\u30a4\u30:
When recruiting members for multiplayer, choose
the mission you want [CR2]to go on together[C].

617.\u300e[\u9060/\u3068\u304a]\u304f\u306e[:
When recruiting members in "Online Play",
you can[CR2]sort by[C] "Friends Only" or "Rank".

618.[\u4ed6/\u307b\u304b]\u306e[\u4eba/\u307:
To join someone else's recruitment,
please join the [CR2]"recruitment list[C].

619.<CMD_FUNC4>\u3092[\u62bc/\u304a]\u305b\u:
Press <CMD_FUNC4> to select the [CR2]search criteria[C]
to search for missions and ranks you want to join.

620.\u305d\u3046\u305d\u3046\u3000[\u52df\u9:
You can also use the <CMD_BUSTERS_COND_ENTER> button on the recruitment
and search criteria to sort missions.

621.\u3042\u3068\u3000\u3059\u3067\u306b\u30:
Also, you won't be able to join a team who's
already been on a mission, so choose quickly!

622.\u30d5\u30ec\u30f3\u30c9\u306b\u306a\u30:
If you become a friend, it will be easier for you to
play together again even after you have split up.

624.\u307f\u3093\u306a\u3068[\u5354\u529b/\u: To work together and complete missions, it's important/nto communicate with each other, isn't it?

625.[\u51fa\u52d5\u524d/\u3057\u3085\u3064\u:
Press <CMD_FUNC2> before or during a mission
to communicate with [CR2]"Chat"[C].

626.\u305f\u3060\u3000[CR2][\u6c7a/\u304d]\u:
But you can only say [CR2]a few lines[C].
If we let you go, you'll talk funny, won't you?

627.\u3042\u3068\u3000\u30df\u30c3\u30b7\u30:
[CR2]You won't be able to fight[C] If you're chatting
during missions, so don't get carried away.

628.\u30c1\u30e3\u30c3\u30c8\u306f\u3000\u30:
You can also use the chat function when
you're playing alone... But isn't that a bit lonely?

629.\u30d0\u30b9\u30bf\u30fc\u30ba\u30df\u30: How to fight in the Busters Missions

630.\u3088\u3057\uff01\u3000\u304a[\u524d/\u:
All right! I'm going to teach you
everything about Busters Missions!

631.\u3068\u3044\u3063\u3066\u3082\u3000[\u5:
As usual, the gameplay is an [CR2]Action Battle[C]!
Use weapons and attack like you are used to!

632.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
We don't have a Watcher, but you can change
the controlled Yo-kai by pressing [$gaiji_key_all_s200]!

633.\u3060\u304c\u3000\u30df\u30c3\u30b7\u30:
On missions, you'll be patrolling the streets!
[CR2]Battle in big fields[C] is different!

634.\u30df\u30c3\u30b7\u30e7\u30f3[\u4e2d/\u:
During missions, keep an eye on the [CR2]mini-map[C]
 to see where you and your enemies are!

635.\u305d\u3057\u3066\u3000\u30df\u30c3\u30:
There is a [CR2]time limit[C] on missions!
When time is up, it's [CR2]mission failed[C]! Watch out!

636.\u30df\u30c3\u30b7\u30e7\u30f3[\u4e2d/\u:
During a mission, you can set the camera and
retire from the mission by pressing <CMD_SETTING_RETIRE>.

637.\u30ea\u30bf\u30a4\u30a2\u3059\u308c\u30:
Retire to quit in the middle of the mission...
but I have faith that you will [CR2]finish[C] the mission!

638.\u30d8\u30eb\u30d7\uff1a\u30df\u30c3\u30: Help: How to fight on a mission

639.[\u5996\u602a/\u3088\u3046\u304b\u3044]\: Defeat Yo-kai and get Oni Orbs!

640.[\u8857/\u307e\u3061]\u306e[\u4e2d/\u306:
The city is crawling with [CR2]Yo-kai[C] who've been released
from the Inferno and are plotting to do evil!

641.\u30d1\u30c8\u30ed\u30fc\u30eb[\u4e2d/\u:
If you find any of these Yo-kai on patrol
attack them hard and destroy them!

642.[\u5730\u7344/\u3058\u3054\u304f]\u306e[:
Defeated Yo-kai will drop [CR2]Oni Orbs[C]!
They can be used in many places!

643.\u30df\u30c3\u30b7\u30e7\u30f3[\u4e2d/\u:
In missions, with the full cooperation of the Busters Assoc.,
all good humans and Yo-kai have disappeared!

644.\u3044\u3044\u304b\uff1f\u3000\u307e\u30:
Understood? Don't worry about what's going on around
you, just beat the hell out of those monsters!

645.\u30d8\u30eb\u30d7\uff1a[\u6575/\u3066\u: Help: Yo-kai Souls and Oni Orbs

646.\u3068\u308a\u3064\u304d\u3067\u3000\u30: Get the upper hand on your mission!

647.\u30df\u30c3\u30b7\u30e7\u30f3[\u4e2d/\u:
Inmissions, with the full cooperation of the Busters Assoc.,
the battle will be between us and enemy Yo-kai.

648.\u305f\u307e\u30fc\u306b\u3000[\u5996\u6:
Occasionally, you can slip into a special person
or Yo-kai who shall participate in battle.

649.[\u5354\u4f1a/\u304d\u3087\u3046\u304b\u:
The inspiriting power is limited... It can't be helped!
We should borrow their power whenever possible!

650.\u305d\u308c\u304c\u3000\u30d0\u30b9\u30:
That's what we call [CR2]"Association"[C] in Busters!
Find a special human or demon, use <CMD_GHOST_NPC> to slip in!

651.\u3068\u308a\u3064\u304d\u306b[\u6210\u5:
You'll be able to control it [CR2]yourself[C] and
[CR2]special abilities[C] will help you in your missions!

652.\u3060\u304c\u3000\u3068\u308a\u3064\u30:
However, inspiriting will be [CR2]deactivated[C] after time
has passed! [CR2]Keep an eye on the gauge! [C]

653.<CMD_CANCEL_GHOST_NPC>[\u9577\u62bc/\u30:
[CR2]Release yourself[C] by pressing and holding <CMD_CANCEL_GHOST_NPC>!
To inspirit someone else, disarm them at once!

654.\u30d0\u30b9\u30bf\u30fc\u30ba\u3067\u30:
Watchers who don't work for Busters
can also help you with your inspiriting!

655.\u30a6\u30a9\u30c3\u30c1\u30e3\u30fc\u30:
With the help of Watchers, we'll be invicible!
Find a human or Yo-kai and use your powers to inspirit it!

657.[\u5473\u65b9/\u307f\u304b\u305f]\u304c[: Save your friends before they ascend!

658.\u30df\u30c3\u30b7\u30e7\u30f3\u3067\u30:
While on missions, if Yo-kai faints,
they will slowly [CR2]"Ascend"[C]!

659.\u3053\u306e\u3068\u304d\u306b[CR2]\u300:
The [CR2]"Ascension Gauge"[C] will decrease and when
the gauge reaches zero, you'll no longer fight!

660.\u3060\u304c\u3000[\u5b8c\u5168/\u304b\u:
Reach the Yo-kai before to save him! Approach
the unconscious lad and revive him with <CMD_HELP>!

661.<CMD_HELP>\u3092[\u62bc/\u304a]\u3057\u3:
Pressing <CMD_HELP> to fill up your Ascension Gauge!
When the gauge is maxed, Yo-kai can [CR2]resurrect[C]!

662.\u30e1\u30f3\u30d0\u30fc[\u5168\u54e1/\u:
If all members faint or ascend, the [CR2]mission will fail[C]!
Resurrect them and try to [CR2]clear the mission[C]!

665.\u30de\u30eb\u30c1\u30d7\u30ec\u30a4\u30:
When you are playing alone, you might think
you can't do anything if you ascend, right?

666.\u3067\u3082\u3000\u305d\u3046\u3044\u30:
Even if you ascend, you can still take the form
of a dog called [CR2]"Dog++"[C].

667.\u307e\u3042\u3000\u30ab\u30f3\u30bf\u30:
Well, if you're a Yo-kai who can be easily beaten,
you should just be a dog, right?

668.\u3051\u3069\u3000\u3077\u3089\u3077\u30:
If you become a Dog++, you can wander around the city
and pick up [CR2]Oni Orbs[C] even if you can't fight.

669.\u3059\u3050\u306b[\u6607\u5929/\u3057\u:
If you're one of those people who get sick easily,
chasing balls while barking might be a good fit for you.

670.\u30d3\u30c3\u30b0\u30dc\u30b9\u30df\u30: Serious competition in the Big Boss Mission!

671.\u30d3\u30c3\u30b0\u30dc\u30b9\u306b\u30:
This is the mission where you can challenge
Big Bosses to a fierce battle: [CR2]"Big Boss Mission"[C]!

672.[\u6700\u521d/\u3055\u3044\u3057\u3087]\:
If you beat the first "Normal" boss, you can
challenge the even stronger [CR2]"Super Mode"[C]!

673.\u305f\u3060\u3057\u3000\u30ce\u30fc\u30:
There's a [CR2]level limit[C] in Normal and Super Mode!
B level can be reduced to a certain level!

674.\u3053\u3061\u3089\u304c[\u5f37/\u3064\u:
If you're too strong, you won't be able to compete.
If you're too strong, you can't compete.

675.\u305d\u3057\u3066\u2026\u3000\u304a[\u5:
Defeat Super Mode to unlock the worst
of the worst. [CR2]"Extreme Mode"[C] missions will be unlocked!

676.[\u6311\u6226/\u3061\u3087\u3046\u305b\u:
You'll need a [CG2]"Super Orb B"[C], but it's a true
battle with no limits for you nor the boss!

677.\u305d\u3057\u3066\u3000[CR2]\u30dc\u30b:
If you use the [CR2]materials bosses drop[C], you can
strengthen weapons dealing more damage to certain tribes!

678.[\uff22/\u30d0\u30b9\u30bf\u30fc\u30ba]\:
It's one thing to go all the way up to level B,
but it's another to beat the big bosses.

drink it to feel like a hard-boiled man.

33.[\u51fa/\u3067]\u3069\u3053\u308d[\u4e0d:

34.\u304a[\u624b\u8efd/\u3066\u304c\u308b]\:

35.\u3068\u308d\u3068\u308d\u30c1\u30fc\u30:

36.[\u7518\u8f9b/\u3042\u307e\u304b\u3089]\:

37.[\u666e\u901a/\u3075\u3064\u3046]\u306e\:

39.\u30e2\u30b0\u30e2\u30b0\u30d0\u30fc\u30:

40.\u30cf\u30f3\u30d0\u30fc\u30ac\u30fc[\u7:

41.[\u71b1/\u3042\u3064]\uff5e\u3044\u304a[:

46.[\u885d\u6483/\u3057\u3087\u3046\u3052\u:

47.[\u4f0a\u52e2/\u3044\u305b]\u30a8\u30d3\:

48.[\u77e5/\u3057]\u308b[\u4eba/\u3072\u306:

49.\u30ab\u30ea\u30c3\u3068\u3057\u305f[\u9:

52.\u30d2\u30e9\u30e1\u306e\u300e\u30d2\u30:

54.\u3053\u3063\u3066\u308a[\u8102/\u3042\u:

57.[\u9ad8\u7d1a/\u3053\u3046\u304d\u3085\u:

58.[\u5357\u56fd/\u306a\u3093\u3054\u304f]\:

59.[\u679c\u6c41/\u304b\u3058\u3085\u3046]\:

63.[\u4e16\u754c/\u305b\u304b\u3044]\u306b[:
